headline.main: Heaviest Air Blow in Pacific Hit Foe at Wake by Surprise; HEAVIEST AIR BLOW HITS FOE AT WAKE AMERICAN FLIERS SMASH AT FOE ON WAKE

lead_paragraph: HONOLULU, Jan. 1 -- The third and biggest announced American raid on Wake Island since the Japanese captured that United States mid-Pacific base on Dec. 23, 1941, was made by a large force of Army heavy bombers early on the day before Christmas, Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, commander of the Pacific Fleet and of American operations in this theatre, disclosed today.
abstract: Wake Island; Adm C W Nimitz reveals heavy US raid on Jap installations, Dec 24; Jap surprise reptd complete; US planes return to base undamaged, crews unhurt; Nimitz comments; lauds Brig Gen H Ramey and Col W A Matheny; previous Wake Is action revd; map
